title: Query Complexity Analyzer Configuration Parameters
description: Defines the canonical configuration parameters, thresholds, and model paths for the Query Complexity Analyzer component within ArchE's cognitive routing system.

sparse_priming_representations.priming_data: CRCS_threshold: 0.3 (queries below this are simple, routed to CRCS). RISE_threshold: 0.7 (queries above this are complex, routed to RISE). Middle_zone: 0.3-0.7 (requires heuristic analysis or hybrid routing).
sentence_count: 0.15, avg_sentence_length: 0.10, vocab_complexity: 0.25, syntactic_depth: 0.20, domain_specificity: 0.15, ambiguity_score: 0.15. Total weight must sum to 1.0.
complexity_model_path: 'models/query_complexity_classifier.pkl'. tokenizer_path: 'models/tokenizer_config.json'. Fallback to rule-based if models unavailable.
Primary: spaCy (en_core_web_sm). Fallback: NLTK. Feature extraction: POS tagging, dependency parsing, named entity recognition.
Max analysis time: 50ms per query. Max memory: 10MB per analysis. Batch processing: enabled for >10 concurrent queries.
Enable threshold auto-tuning based on routing success rate. Log misroutes to ThoughtTrail. Trigger ACO review if misroute rate >10%.

usage_notes: This SPR is referenced by specifications/query_complexity_analyzer.md. Update this configuration when tuning routing behavior or model parameters. All changes trigger a Guardian review event.
